author: dwayne
title: DAO-NET: Sybil Defense DAO
description: Sybil耐性のある匿名認証はDAOにとって共通の課題ですが、Cardanoにはオープンソースのソリューションやサービスはありません。

f6_assessments.q0:
Cardanoがアイデンティティの重要性を主張していることは、重要な特徴と比較優位の一つです。一般的なDAO-NETインフラは、法的な枠組みだけでなく、DAOの資金調達の必要性や、DAOがすべての法令遵守要件を備えた現実世界と統合することを可能にする様々な側面を考慮した、野心的な展開プラットフォームです。その中でも特に重要なのが、アイデンティティを証明する仕組みであり、これはDAOが他のブロックチェーンではなく、カルダノを選択するきっかけになることは間違いありません。

フィードバック：Sybil attackとは何かという説明を入れてみてはいかがでしょうか。また、Sybil攻撃に対して堅牢であることがなぜ重要なのか、その理由をもっと強調することで、この提案を高めることができます。
f6_assessments.q1:
提案者は、LinkedInのプロフィールへのリンクを掲載し、29年に及ぶITコンサルタント／ソフトウェア開発の経験を示しています。もちろん、必要なバックグラウンドを持つチームメンバーがいないことは確かですが、どのような役割を求めているのか、また、そのチームメンバーにどのようなスキルを求めているのかを明確にしています。これは、彼らが適切な背景調査を行い、自分たちの知識の限界を明確に認識していることを示していますが、さらに重要なのは、これを解決するために何が必要かを見極める能力があるということです。タイムラインは透明で、月ごとの目標に分けられています。これがどこまで現実的かを評価するのは難しいが（第三者監査は2022年5月、テストネットは2022年6月）、非常にしっかりしたチームであれば可能である。複雑なプロセスには遅れがつきものですが、この計画と多くの詳細から、彼らがこのソリューションの開発に真剣に取り組んでいることが伝わってくるため、星5つとしました。また、リスク軽減のための分析も含まれています。

フィードバック：DAO-NETには多くの提案があり、それぞれが独立して実行できるように予算が組まれていることから、これらすべてのプロジェクトの調整に関連する作業の一部をどのようにして軽減するかを説明する短い説明または何らかの形のコンティンジェンシープランも含めることを提案します（実際の細かい作業を行う有能な開発者をリクルートできることが前提です）。
f6_assessments.q2: この提案書には、成功のための月ごとの明確な指標が含まれているだけでなく、3ヶ月、6ヶ月、12ヶ月、そして各ステージ（テストネット、一般公開）の明確な開始日も含まれています。さらに、プロジェクトの進捗状況を継続的に確認できるように、GitHubレポへのリンクも記載されています。最後に、KPIの指標として、6ヶ月目までに6つのDAOが利用することや、1000人以上のDAOメンバーが利用することなど、測定可能な指標を記載しています。

f6_assessments.q0: Create a DAO to develop secure, open source anti-Sybil anonymous authentication solutions for the DAO Net. Creating a DAO will maintain and improve the solution in the future and provide the solution as a service to other DAOs. I totally agree with this idea, it is deployable on many other DAO projects and fits the criteria of the challenge
f6_assessments.q1: "Using open source Proof of Humanity for Ethereum will be migrated to Cardano. This idea's solution was also used by the team for the ""DAO-NET: DAO Deployment Platform"" idea that the team submitted in this challenge. The team identity is public and experienced in the development of Plutus, key partners are public. The proposed amount should state how much to use for which item, for example the number of members involved in smart contract development"
f6_assessments.q2: "This idea is a functional part of the ""DAO-NET: DAO Deployment Platform"" idea that the team also proposed in this challenge. The team needs to add indicators to measure the success of each content to be implemented. Challenges and risks are also mentioned, it would be great to have solutions to these risks."

f6_assessments.q0: This is an open sourced proof of humanity solution that will be sybil-resistant and other daos will be able to take advantage of it. I really like the idea of this project being open source, because the ecosystem really needs this right now. Your proposal is in line with the challenge settings considering it's tooling for daos. The authors managed to convinse me in the value they will be bringing to the cardano ecosystem. I know Dwayne Collard is an active member of the community and is a voice of reason in the telegram channels.  The key metrics are really well thought through and are pointing in the right direction to measure adoption. Currently I don't see anythig missing in this proposal.   As a developer I was a bit concerned about finding the right people, but then I saw they started looking for people at the end of november and will have separate teams for their different proposals and each proposal is a standalone project. So no worries there.
f6_assessments.q1: There are plenty of links left to verify the team members credability and I really like the structured way of this proposal, saying what the needed skillset of the future team members and showing what they already have as well as what they're looking for. I can appreciate the transparency that brings. IMHO this brings credability to the peorject in the eyes of the voters (me included).  The budget is outlined clearly and is broken down well enough to be understandable by everyone reading the proposal. The execution plan seems very reasonable, although it depends on whether or not they will be able to find those mentioned team members. As a developer I believe the timetable is realistic to do the mentioned work. The fact that it's open source adds to the credability of the project and helps it to scale if necessary. I also love how there's a plan for self funding down the line. Not many proposal think in that direction and this is what separates the long lasting project apart from the short term ones in my oppinion. The plan describes the resources necessary to implement the proposal along with a very detailed list of possible future challenges along with an even longer list of mitigations for those challenges.  There are resources linked in the proposal for anyone that wishes to read on about the more technical part of the project.  Overall I have no doubt that the project is not only feasible but it will last. I will vot for you!
f6_assessments.q2: There's no shortage of information for the community to follow along with the projects development. There's a linked github repo where all development will happen, so that's more than enough for anyone looking at the proposal to follow along with the growth of the project. The metrics and KPIs are on point, and there's a succinct definition of succes. Roadmap - check, milestones - check and a time horizon to bring all the parts together. The problem and solutions statements make sure to explain in an understandable manner what the proposal is all about.   Overall a great idea, a great proposal that will be auditable by the community.

f6_assessments.q0: The team proposes an open source solution for anonymous identity management for DOA. If successful the proposal will create a better solution (Proof of Humanity) to manage a DAO on the Cardano blockchain, this directly addresses the challenge brief and thus in my opinion the proposal is aligned with the challenge brief.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal addresses risk and mitigation very well, various risk were identified and mitigations proposed. The team have a plan for future funding and laid out the goals and road to market. The team provided links to LinkedIn for the team leaders and also provided a link to a github. The team leaders appear experienced to successfully execute the project, however, the team is not complete, it appears that the team still has to find three developers (cryptography, Plutus, Frontend Dev). The time required to find and hire the correct team members (contractors) might affect the team’s ability to execute successfully and on time.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal provided a detailed roadmap and budget. KPIs were identified and tied to measurables. It would be great if the team could connect the roadmap and budget to the deliverables, at the moment the budget is mainly allocated to pay for labour (Developer @ $4k for 6months) , if the budget (labor) is connected to the roadmap and deliverables the team can track spending over time versus performance. My one concern is the size of the ask, $94,400 – I would advise the team to break down the budget to run from catalyst fund to catalyst fund (roughly 3month period), the catalyst community in past have supported projects over multiple funds (example MinSwap)

solution: DAO Netや他のDAOのために、安全でオープンソースのSybil耐性のある匿名認証ソリューションを開発するDAOを設立する。
experience: ブロックチェーン開発者、Plutusのパイオニア、SPOオペレーター、コミュニティアドバイザー、ソリューションアナリストからなる経験豊富なチームです。
